file_content.text: I'm doing my best, I swear.
I advise that you proceed to the shuttle bay. The flight to the Brentaal Star may be hazardous--but Grand Moff Kilran has complete faith in your abilities.
Damage reports from all decks. We're holding together, sir--but I don't know for how long.
Make it last, Ensign. Don't let us down.
Make sure it's long enough, Ensign. Your life and career are at stake.
Please stand alert. Grand Moff Kilran's representatives have returned.
Please stand alert. Grand Moff Kilran's representative has returned.
I see you took care of the Republic assault. Welcome back to the bridge.
Status report?
Thank you, Captain.
Appreciated.
I am Sith, and you will address me as "my lord."
Respect your betters.
... Yes. I apologize, my lord.
You mean "Welcome back to the bridge, sir."
Respect your superiors.
... Yes. Welcome back to the bridge, sir.
We've survived the first wave of attacks from the Brentaal Star. Things will be calm until we enter fighter range--another minute, maybe two.
Congratulations, my lord. Security reports that the sabotage droids have been destroyed.
Congratulations, sir. Security reports that the sabotage droids have been destroyed.
Status report?
I'm talented.
I don't need your praise, Lieutenant. Only your obedience.
Don't try fawning over me.
Oh, please, please don't kill us....
Shut up, Ensign, or I'll kill you myself.
Yes. Yes, of course.
We've penetrated the Brentaal Star's outer defenses. Their next assault won't come until we enter fighter range--another minute, maybe two.
Transmission coming in! Long range... it's a message, but it's not from the Brentaal Star.
Put it through, Ensign.
Let's hear.
What?
The Brentaal Star must have sent a distress signal. Someone's responding.
Yes? And?
I'll patch the message through immediately.
This is Jedi Master Tannar Va to unidentified Imperial starship. It's time to stop your attack--you've done enough.
I'm en route to your location with sixteen Republic vessels. We're going to rendezvous with the Brentaal Star, and I'm asking you to leave now before more lives are lost.
Your pleading is pointless, Jedi. I am Sith, and there is nothing you can do to stop me.
Fool.
It doesn't have to happen this way.
Are you afraid there won't be a ship left to find? That I'll destroy your friends before you can reach me?
Oh, really?
It's not fear that I feel. It's concern--for you, and for my friends, too.
The Empire doesn't turn and run so easily. Your ship brought this upon itself.
This is an Imperial concern.
You can make those claims if you want, but we both know that's not true.
All you're going to do is earn me hazard pay. You don't scare me, Jedi.
I'm sure not worried.
I'm not trying to scare you. I want you to see reason.
Master Tannar Va--it's a pleasure to meet you. I'm sure we can resolve this peacefully.
Let's talk this out.
I'm glad to hear the voice of reason. I hope you mean what you say.
Disregard the transmission. Continue closing on the Brentaal Star.
Keep attacking, Ensign.
Understood. Maintaining course and speed.
Listen. The Brentaal Star was part of my convoy. We were ambushed, and we sent the Star ahead--but we will reunite.
I just crippled three Imperial dreadnaughts. I don't want to destroy you--the peace between Republic and Empire is fragile enough already.
What about the stolen secrets aboard the Brentaal Star? Is the general upholding the "peace"?
I know what's on that ship.
The general can speak for himself--but yes, I believe he does work for peace.
Tell the Brentaal Star to hand over the general. No one needs to be hurt.
All I want is one man.
I can't. The general has a role to play with the Republic.
Fragile enough to be crushed like glass. The same way I'll crush you.
Fragile like bone.
Your base aggression serves no one--not even your Empire.
Peace is a lie, Jedi. The Sith know this.
Foolish Knight.
I won't be drawn into a philosophical debate.
If you're afraid of the diplomatic consequences, why not meet us alone? Without Republic backing?
Don't hide behind "peace."
Because there are lives at stake here--not just my pride.
I don't play politics. Take it somewhere else.
I'm not Imperial.
Even Mandalorians respect sentient life. This isn't about politics.
Incidents like this are happening across the galaxy--but only because we let them. Leave the Brentaal Star to me.
If you don't, then may the Force be with you--because the men and women aboard that ship can hold you off until we arrive. And you will be defeated.
You're deluding yourself. The ship is already mine.
No, I won't.
We'll see about that. End transmission.
Close the channel.
Affirmative. Ending transmission.
You're still talking?
You've made yourself clear. But I suggest you prepare to face a Jedi--and I suggest you consider what that means.
Entering fighter range. The Brentaal Star is launching its first squadron.
It's time for us to do the same. I assume you'll lead the boarding party to go after the general?
All right. All right. We're close enough to fly in and send a raiding party. I assume you're going?
Whatever's necessary to finish this.
I am.
Prepare to be amazed.
Good luck. I'm sure you'll have the general in your hands in no time.
Before you go, you should know something. Most of the marines will back you up, but we had to execute a few for refusing to fight.
We'll be awaiting your successful return.
Is there a reason your marines can't handle this?
Why me?
We suffered heavy losses in the attack. The marines can back you up, but they can't raid that ship on their own.
There's one other thing. I promised you my help, so--I brought you some supplies from the cargo bay.
Someone on Dromund Kaas may be disappointed when they don't receive the delivery, but I thought our situation took precedence.
You're doing well, Captain. Continue, and we may make it out of this.
That should help.
Great!
Thank you. We're all doing our best, here.
I don't need your sniveling, Captain. I have a task to perform.
You're pathetic.
Yes, of course. I understand.
Not enough of them in the first place. Then half were injured when the droids attacked, and we had to shoot another dozen for not fighting.
They were terrified, after what happened to the captain. They panicked.
They're dead now, anyway.
We did retrieve their equipment. It's yours. We're doing our very best to serve you, I swear.
You've done well--so far. Continue, and all will end well.
Excellent.
You're doing fine, Ensign. I'm not going to hurt you.
Don't worry.
Idiot.
Ignore him--I'll make sure he doesn't trouble you in the future.
Not enough of them in the first place, and now half of them are injured. They can back you up, but that's about it.
